member.name: T:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeProcessHandle
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Provides a managed wrapper for a process handle.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafeProcessHandle.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: [SECURITY CRITICAL] Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified handle, indicating whether to release the handle during the finalization phase.
member.param: The handle to be wrapped.
true to reliably let release the handle during the finalization phase; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.Process

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Process.BasePriority
member.summary: Gets the base priority of the associated process.
member.returns: The base priority, which is computed from the of the associated process.

The process has exited.-or- The process has not started, so there is no process ID.

member.summary: Begins asynchronous read operations on the redirected stream of the application.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Process.CancelErrorRead

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Process.CancelOutputRead
member.summary: Cancels the asynchronous read operation on the redirected stream of an application.
member.exception: The stream is not enabled for asynchronous read operations.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Process.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Release all resources used by this process.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Process.EnableRaisingEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the event should be raised when the process terminates.
member.returns: true if the event should be raised when the associated process is terminated (through either an exit or a call to ); otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Process.EnterDebugMode
member.summary: Puts a component in state to interact with operating system processes that run in a special mode by enabling the native property SeDebugPrivilege on the current thread.

member.name: E:System.Diagnostics.Process.ErrorDataReceived
member.summary: Occurs when an application writes to its redirected stream.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Process.ExitCode
member.summary: Gets the value that the associated process specified when it terminated.
member.returns: The code that the associated process specified when it terminated.
member.exception: The process has not exited.-or- The process is not valid.
You are trying to access the property for a process that is running on a remote computer. This property is available only for processes that are running on the local computer.

member.name: E:System.Diagnostics.Process.Exited
member.summary: Occurs when a process exits.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.Process.ExitTime
member.summary: Gets the time that the associated process exited.
member.returns: A that indicates when the associated process was terminated.
member.exception: The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition (Windows Me), which does not support this property.
You are trying to access the property for a process that is running on a remote computer. This property is available only for processes that are running on the local computer.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Process.GetCurrentProcess
member.summary: Gets a new component and associates it with the currently active process.
member.returns: A new component associated with the process resource that is running the calling application.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Process.GetProcessById(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a new component, given the identifier of a process on the local computer.
member.returns: A component that is associated with the local process resource identified by the parameter.
member.param: The system-unique identifier of a process resource.
member.exception: The process specified by the parameter is not running. The identifier might be expired.
The process was not started by this object.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Process.GetProcessById(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a new component, given a process identifier and the name of a computer on the network.

The name of a computer on the network.

The parameter is null.
The process was not started by this object.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Process.GetProcesses
member.summary: Creates a new component for each process resource on the local computer.
member.returns: An array of type that represents all the process resources running on the local computer.

A problem occurred accessing an underlying system API.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Process.Start
member.summary: Starts (or reuses) the process resource that is specified by the property of this component and associates it with the component.
member.returns: true if a process resource is started; false if no new process resource is started (for example, if an existing process is reused).
member.exception: No file name was specified in the component's .-or- The member of the property is true while , , or is true.
There was an error in opening the associated file.
The process object has already been disposed.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.Process.Start(System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo)
member.summary: Starts the process resource that is specified by the parameter containing process start information (for example, the file name of the process to start) and associates the resource with a new component.
member.returns: A new that is associated with the process resource, or null if no process resource is started. Note that a new process that’s started alongside already running instances of the same process will be independent from the others. In addition, Start may return a non-null Process with its property already set to true. In this case, the started process may have activated an existing instance of itself and then exited.
member.param: The that contains the information that is used to start the process, including the file name and any command-line arguments.
member.exception: No file name was specified in the parameter's property.-or- The property of the parameter is true and the , , or property is also true.-or-The property of the parameter is true and the property is not null or empty or the property is not null.
The parameter is null.
The process object has already been disposed.
The file specified in the parameter's property could not be found.

An error occurred when opening the associated file. -or-The sum of the length of the arguments and the length of the full path to the process exceeds 2080. The error message associated with this exception can be one of the following: "The data area passed to a system call is too small." or "Access is denied."

member.returns: The fully qualified path that defines the location of the module.

member.summary: Gets the amount of memory that is required to load the module.
member.returns: The size, in bytes, of the memory that the module occupies.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessModule.ModuleName
member.summary: Gets the name of the process module.
member.returns: The name of the module.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.ProcessModule.ToString
member.summary: Converts the name of the module to a string.
member.returns: The value of the property.

member.param: An array of instances with which to initialize this instance.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified process module exists in the collection.
member.returns: true if the module exists in the collection; otherwise, false.
member.param: A instance that indicates the module to find in this collection.

member.summary: Copies an array of instances to the collection, at the specified index.

The location at which to add the new instances.

member.summary: Provides the location of a specified module within the collection.
member.returns: The zero-based index that defines the location of the module within the .
member.param: The whose index is retrieved.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.ProcessPriorityClass
member.summary: Indicates the priority that the system associates with a process. This value, together with the priority value of each thread of the process, determines each thread's base priority level.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ProcessPriorityClass.AboveNormal
member.summary: Specifies that the process has priority above Normal but below .

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ProcessPriorityClass.BelowNormal
member.summary: Specifies that the process has priority above Idle but below Normal.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ProcessPriorityClass.High
member.summary: Specifies that the process performs time-critical tasks that must be executed immediately, such as the Task List dialog, which must respond quickly when called by the user, regardless of the load on the operating system. The threads of the process preempt the threads of normal or idle priority class processes.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ProcessPriorityClass.Idle
member.summary: Specifies that the threads of this process run only when the system is idle, such as a screen saver. The threads of the process are preempted by the threads of any process running in a higher priority class.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ProcessPriorityClass.Normal
member.summary: Specifies that the process has no special scheduling needs.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ProcessPriorityClass.RealTime
member.summary: Specifies that the process has the highest possible priority.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo
member.summary: Specifies a set of values that are used when you start a process.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class without specifying a file name with which to start the process.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and specifies a file name such as an application or document with which to start the process.
member.param: An application or document with which to start a process.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifies an application file name with which to start the process, and specifies a set of command-line arguments to pass to the application.
member.param: An application with which to start a process.
Command-line arguments to pass to the application when the process starts.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.Arguments
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of command-line arguments to use when starting the application.
member.returns: A single string containing the arguments to pass to the target application specified in the property. The default is an empty string (""). On Windows Vista and earlier versions of the Windows operating system, the length of the arguments added to the length of the full path to the process must be less than 2080. On Windows 7 and later versions, the length must be less than 32699.Arguments are parsed and interpreted by the target application, so must align with the expectations of that application. For.NET applications as demonstrated in the Examples below, spaces are interpreted as a separator between multiple arguments. A single argument that includes spaces must be surrounded by quotation marks, but those quotation marks are not carried through to the target application. In include quotation marks in the final parsed argument, triple-escape each mark.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.CreateNoWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to start the process in a new window.
member.returns: true if the process should be started without creating a new window to contain it; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.Domain
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that identifies the domain to use when starting the process.
member.returns: The Active Directory domain to use when starting the process. The domain property is primarily of interest to users within enterprise environments that use Active Directory.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the application or document to start.
member.returns: The name of the application to start, or the name of a document of a file type that is associated with an application and that has a default open action available to it. The default is an empty string ("").

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.LoadUserProfile
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the Windows user profile is to be loaded from the registry.
member.returns: true if the Windows user profile should be loaded; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets a secure string that contains the user password to use when starting the process.
member.returns: The user password to use when starting the process.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.RedirectStandardError
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the error output of an application is written to the stream.
member.returns: true if error output should be written to ; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.RedirectStandardInput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the input for an application is read from the stream.
member.returns: true if input should be read from ; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.RedirectStandardOutput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the textual output of an application is written to the stream.
member.returns: true if output should be written to ; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.StandardErrorEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred encoding for error output.
member.returns: An object that represents the preferred encoding for error output. The default is null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.StandardOutputEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred encoding for standard output.
member.returns: An object that represents the preferred encoding for standard output. The default is null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.UserName
member.summary: Gets or sets the user name to be used when starting the process.
member.returns: The user name to use when starting the process.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.UseShellExecute
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use the operating system shell to start the process.
member.returns: true if the shell should be used when starting the process; false if the process should be created directly from the executable file. The default is true.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: When the property is false, gets or sets the working directory for the process to be started. When is true, gets or sets the directory that contains the process to be started.
member.returns: When is true, the fully qualified name of the directory that contains the process to be started. When the property is false, the working directory for the process to be started. The default is an empty string ("").

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread
member.summary: Represents an operating system process thread.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.BasePriority
member.summary: Gets the base priority of the thread.
member.returns: The base priority of the thread, which the operating system computes by combining the process priority class with the priority level of the associated thread.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.CurrentPriority
member.summary: Gets the current priority of the thread.
member.returns: The current priority of the thread, which may deviate from the base priority based on how the operating system is scheduling the thread. The priority may be temporarily boosted for an active thread.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the thread.
member.returns: The unique identifier associated with a specific thread.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.IdealProcessor
member.summary: Sets the preferred processor for this thread to run on.
member.returns: The preferred processor for the thread, used when the system schedules threads, to determine which processor to run the thread on.
member.exception: The system could not set the thread to start on the specified processor.
The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.PriorityBoostEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the operating system should temporarily boost the priority of the associated thread whenever the main window of the thread's process receives the focus.
member.returns: true to boost the thread's priority when the user interacts with the process's interface; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.exception: The priority boost information could not be retrieved.-or-The priority boost information could not be set.
The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.PriorityLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority level of the thread.
member.returns: One of the values, specifying a range that bounds the thread's priority.
member.exception: The thread priority level information could not be retrieved. -or-The thread priority level could not be set.
The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.PrivilegedProcessorTime
member.summary: Gets the amount of time that the thread has spent running code inside the operating system core.
member.returns: A indicating the amount of time that the thread has spent running code inside the operating system core.
member.exception: The thread time could not be retrieved.
The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.ProcessorAffinity
member.summary: Sets the processors on which the associated thread can run.
member.returns: An that points to a set of bits, each of which represents a processor that the thread can run on.
member.exception: The processor affinity could not be set.
The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.ResetIdealProcessor
member.summary: Resets the ideal processor for this thread to indicate that there is no single ideal processor. In other words, so that any processor is ideal.
member.exception: The ideal processor could not be reset.
The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.StartAddress
member.summary: Gets the memory address of the function that the operating system called that started this thread.
member.returns: The thread's starting address, which points to the application-defined function that the thread executes.
member.exception: The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.StartTime
member.summary: Gets the time that the operating system started the thread.
member.returns: A representing the time that was on the system when the operating system started the thread.
member.exception: The thread time could not be retrieved.
The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.ThreadState
member.summary: Gets the current state of this thread.
member.returns: A that indicates the thread's execution, for example, running, waiting, or terminated.
member.exception: The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.TotalProcessorTime
member.summary: Gets the total amount of time that this thread has spent using the processor.
member.returns: A that indicates the amount of time that the thread has had control of the processor.
member.exception: The thread time could not be retrieved.
The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.UserProcessorTime
member.summary: Gets the amount of time that the associated thread has spent running code inside the application.
member.returns: A indicating the amount of time that the thread has spent running code inside the application, as opposed to inside the operating system core.
member.exception: The thread time could not be retrieved.
The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread.WaitReason
member.summary: Gets the reason that the thread is waiting.
member.returns: A representing the reason that the thread is in the wait state.
member.exception: The thread is not in the wait state.
The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
The process is on a remote computer.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThreadCollection
member.summary: Provides a strongly typed collection of objects.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with no associated instances.

The location at which to add the new instances.

member.returns: The zero-based index that defines the location of the thread within the .
member.param: The whose index is retrieved.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThreadCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an index for iterating over the set of process threads.
member.returns: A that indexes the threads in the collection.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.ProcessThreadCollection.Remove(System.Diagnostics.ProcessThread)
member.summary: Deletes a process thread from the collection.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.ThreadPriorityLevel
member.summary: Specifies the priority level of a thread.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadPriorityLevel.AboveNormal
member.summary: Specifies one step above the normal priority for the associated .

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadPriorityLevel.BelowNormal
member.summary: Specifies one step below the normal priority for the associated .

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadPriorityLevel.Highest
member.summary: Specifies highest priority. This is two steps above the normal priority for the associated .

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadPriorityLevel.Idle
member.summary: Specifies idle priority. This is the lowest possible priority value of all threads, independent of the value of the associated .

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadPriorityLevel.Lowest
member.summary: Specifies lowest priority. This is two steps below the normal priority for the associated .

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadPriorityLevel.Normal
member.summary: Specifies normal priority for the associated .

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadPriorityLevel.TimeCritical
member.summary: Specifies time-critical priority. This is the highest priority of all threads, independent of the value of the associated .

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.ThreadState
member.summary: Specifies the current execution state of the thread.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadState.Initialized
member.summary: A state that indicates the thread has been initialized, but has not yet started.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadState.Ready
member.summary: A state that indicates the thread is waiting to use a processor because no processor is free. The thread is prepared to run on the next available processor.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadState.Running
member.summary: A state that indicates the thread is currently using a processor.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadState.Standby
member.summary: A state that indicates the thread is about to use a processor. Only one thread can be in this state at a time.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadState.Terminated
member.summary: A state that indicates the thread has finished executing and has exited.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadState.Transition
member.summary: A state that indicates the thread is waiting for a resource, other than the processor, before it can execute. For example, it might be waiting for its execution stack to be paged in from disk.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadState.Unknown
member.summary: The state of the thread is unknown.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadState.Wait
member.summary: A state that indicates the thread is not ready to use the processor because it is waiting for a peripheral operation to complete or a resource to become free. When the thread is ready, it will be rescheduled.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason
member.summary: Specifies the reason a thread is waiting.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.EventPairHigh
member.summary: The thread is waiting for event pair high.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.EventPairLow
member.summary: The thread is waiting for event pair low.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.ExecutionDelay
member.summary: Thread execution is delayed.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.Executive
member.summary: The thread is waiting for the scheduler.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.FreePage
member.summary: The thread is waiting for a free virtual memory page.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.LpcReceive
member.summary: The thread is waiting for a local procedure call to arrive.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.LpcReply
member.summary: The thread is waiting for reply to a local procedure call to arrive.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.PageIn
member.summary: The thread is waiting for a virtual memory page to arrive in memory.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.PageOut
member.summary: The thread is waiting for a virtual memory page to be written to disk.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.Suspended
member.summary: Thread execution is suspended.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.SystemAllocation
member.summary: The thread is waiting for system allocation.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.Unknown
member.summary: The thread is waiting for an unknown reason.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.UserRequest
member.summary: The thread is waiting for a user request.

member.name: F:System.Diagnostics.ThreadWaitReason.VirtualMemory
member.summary: The thread is waiting for the system to allocate virtual memory.
